ADRM1: Proteasomal ubiquitin receptor protein mediating selective protein degradation through ATP-dependent proteolysis, interacts with deubiquitinating enzymes and regulatory particle subunits, localized primarily to cytoplasm and nucleus within 26S proteasome complexes, functions in ubiquitin-proteasome pathway and protein quality control systems, regulates cell cycle progression, apoptosis, DNA damage repair, protein homeostasis maintenance, and cellular adhesion processes through indirect mechanisms, commonly dysregulated in various cancers and degenerative disorders. CTBP2: Transcriptional corepressor containing NAD+ binding domain similar to dehydrogenases, catalyzing chromatin-mediated gene silencing through recruitment of histone-modifying complexes. Exhibits tissue-specific expression patterns with evolutionary conservation across mammalian species, suggesting fundamental roles in reproductive physiology and vascular homeostasis. Activates downstream signaling through receptor binding and ligand delivery, contributing to cellular communication networks. Commonly altered in inflammatory cardiovascular conditions and reproductive disorders, indicating involvement in disease-associated vascular leakage and fertility dysfunction. Represents clustered gene family member with tandem duplication evolution, sharing structural conservation despite sequence divergence. Participates in organ-specific secretory processes while maintaining broader functions in lipid transport and membrane stability regulation.

Participates in osteoblast-osteoclast coupling during bone remodeling through modulation of bone formation and resorption balance. Oncogenic potential demonstrated through activation of growth-promoting signaling networks in epithelial malignancies. Regulatory role extends to metabolic crosstalk between hepatic and skeletal systems. Protein structure facilitates protein-protein interactions with diverse nuclear factors involved in chromatin organization and gene expression control. Expression patterns suggest involvement in developmental processes governing skeletal morphogenesis and maintenance of bone homeostasis throughout adult life.
